#Opening packages:
```{r setup, include=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, message=FALSE, warning = FALSE)

# significance tests and data exploration
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(kableExtra)
library(ggbeeswarm)
library(broom)
library(randomForest)
library(caret)

# spatial analysis
library(sf)
library(tmap)
library(maptools)
library(gstat)
library(stars)
library(SpatialKDE)
```

#Opening and exploring data

Open soil and elevation data:
```{r}
soils <- read_csv(here("data", "shift_soil_data.csv")) %>% 
  mutate(date = lubridate::mdy(date),
         week = lubridate::week(date)) %>%
  select(soil_id:transect, meter_location, electro_cond_mS_per_cm, season, latitude, longitude)%>% 
  drop_na()

soils_sf <- read_sf(here("data", "soil_w_elevation.shp")) %>% 
  mutate(date = lubridate::ymd(date)) %>% 
  select(electro_co, date, transect, meter_loca) %>% 
  mutate(electro_co = as.numeric(electro_co)) %>% 
  drop_na()

dem <- read_stars(here("data", "dem.tif")) %>% 
  st_extract(soils_sf$geometry)
```

Join soil and elevation data:
```{r}
dem_soils <- dem %>% 
  cbind(soils)
```

Descriptive statistics:
```{r}
soils %>% 
  group_by(transect) %>% 
  summarize(min = min(electro_cond_mS_per_cm),
            max = max(electro_cond_mS_per_cm),
            mean = mean(electro_cond_mS_per_cm),
            dev = sd(electro_cond_mS_per_cm),
            variance = var(electro_cond_mS_per_cm)) %>% 
  kableExtra::kable() %>% 
  kableExtra::kable_classic(lightable_options = "striped")


soil_stats <- soils %>% 
  group_by(transect) %>% 
  summarize(mean = mean(electro_cond_mS_per_cm),
            max = max(electro_cond_mS_per_cm),
            min = min(electro_cond_mS_per_cm),
            range = max - min)
```

Plot salinity v elevation
```{r}
strip_labels <- c("COPR_1_EW" = "COPR 1 EW",

ggplot(dem_soils, aes(x = dem.tif, y = electro_cond_mS_per_cm, color = transect)) +
```

Random Forest regression of Soil salinity and elevation
```{r}
fit_ele <- randomForest(electro_cond_mS_per_cm ~ dem.tif, data = dem_soils, importance = TRUE)

ggplot()+
  geom_point(aes(x= dem_soils$electro_cond_mS_per_cm, y = fit_ele$predicted), color = "#E69512")+
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", aes(x= dem_soils$electro_cond_mS_per_cm, y = fit_ele$predicted), color =  "#3A5D3D")+
  labs(x = "Actual Electrical Conductivity (mS/cm)",
       y = "Predicted Electrical conductivity (mS/cm)")+
  ggtitle("Soil Electrical Conductivity Predictions by Elevation")+
  theme(plot.title = element_text(color = "#5b4f41", size = 16, hjust = 0.5),
        plot.background = element_rect("white"),
        panel.background = element_rect("#faf7f2"),
        panel.grid = element_line(linetype= "longdash", color = "#f0ece1"),
        axis.text = element_text(color = "#5b4f41"),
        axis.title = element_text(color = "#5b4f41"),
        strip.background = element_rect("#f8f8f8"),
        strip.text = element_text(color = "#5b4f41"),
        axis.line = element_line(color = "#5b4f41"))

ggsave(filename = "ele_plot.png", plot = last_plot(), width = 12, height = 8, device = "png", dpi = 500)
elevation_cor <- cor(x= dem_soils$electro_cond_mS_per_cm, y = fit_ele$predicted)
elevation_cor
```

#Options for extracting pixel values:

Option 1:
```{r}
# Assume `soil_raster` is a raster object containing soil data and `soil_pts` is a data frame containing point locations
# We will extract soil values for each week, where each week is defined by unique values in `soil_pts$week` column
# We will also take a subset of points for each week, where each subset contains points corresponding to the current week

# Get unique weeks from `soil_pts` data frame
weeks <- unique(soil_pts$week)

# Create an empty list to store extracted values
extracted_values <- list()

# Loop over each week
for (i in seq_along(weeks)) {
  # Get current week value
  current_week <- weeks[i]
  
  # Subset points for the current week
  current_pts <- soil_pts[soil_pts$week == current_week, ]
  
  # Extract soil values for current week
  current_values <- extract(soil_raster, current_pts)
  
  # Store extracted values in list
  extracted_values[[i]] <- current_values
}

# `extracted_values` now contains a list of extracted values for each week
```

Option 2:
```{r}
# load weekly raster images
rasters <- list.files(here("data"), pattern = "*.tif", full.names = TRUE)
rasters <- stack(rasters)

# load weekly point data
points <- soils_sf %>% 
  mutate(week = lubridate::week(date))

# extract pixel values for each week
for (week in unique(points$week)) {
  # subset points for the current week
  week_points <- points[points$week == week, ]
  
  # extract pixel values for each point
  values <- extract(rasters[[week]], week_points[, c("x", "y")])
  
  # combine point data with extracted values
  week_points <- rbind(week_points, values)
}
```
